title: The Case of the Missing Pie Chart
summary: A perfectly normal PIE CHART vanished and was replaced with an actual pie wearing a tiny tie. Solve four fraction/decimal/percent clues to find the liar.

introLetter.subjectLine: URGENT: Our pie chart has become… a real pie. It’s networking.
bodyParagraphs: This morning, Town Hall’s Official Pie Chart (VERY IMPORTANT, VERY CIRCULAR) disappeared.
In its place: a real pie wearing a tiny tie, handing out business cards that say ‘CEO of Crust’.
Three suspects were seen arguing about fractions, decimals, and percentages like it’s a sport.
Please solve the clues before the pie starts filing taxes.

postmark.stampSlogan: Goofington Postal Service: We Deliver. The Pie Delivers ThreatS.

suspects.name: Countess Halfalina

alibi.claim: I only took 1/4 of the chart! That’s 0.4… which is 40%. I am VERY precise.
alibi.note: Her conversions should match the trio-matching evidence.

quips: I’m not dramatic. I’m 100% emotionally accurate.
Milk is just a fraction of my personality.
If I blink twice, it’s because I’m dividing.

suspects.name: Professor Decimalton
suspects.roleTagline: Mad Scientist of Tenths (and Occasional Hundredths)

alibi.claim: I measured 0.75 of the chart with a laser ruler. That’s 75%, aka 3/4. Boom. Science.
alibi.note: His number-line marks should line up with the decimal clue.

quips: My lab coat has pockets for rounding.
I once fought a comma. I won.

suspects.name: Captain Percentula

alibi.claim: I gave away 50% of my snacks, which is 1/2. I’m basically a hero with crumbs.
alibi.note: His ‘half’ claims should agree with the fraction-pie clue.

quips: Everything is 200% better with a cape.
I can sell you a percent of a percent.
If you need 10% more confidence, I got you.

locations.name: Town Hall Pie Chart Vault
locations.description: A room so official it smells like paperwork and cinnamon.

locations.name: Decimalton’s Laser Ruler Lab
locations.description: Buzzing machines. Beeping rulers. A single ominous calculator.

locations.name: The Snack Deck (Percentula’s Cape Zone)
locations.description: A snack bar with a chalkboard that only says ‘LIMIT: 100%’.

evidence.label: Pie Crumbs (Highly Suspicious)
evidence.description: Exactly 6/8 of the pie is missing. That’s either a clue… or breakfast.

evidence.label: Greasy Number-Line Smear
evidence.description: Someone dragged a marker across decimals like a tiny slippery penguin.

evidence.label: Percent Paint Splatter
evidence.description: A receipt reads: ‘Painted exactly 25% of the sprinkles. No refunds.’

evidence.label: The Triple-Identity Chart
evidence.description: Fractions, decimals, and percents wearing matching outfits. Very suspicious. Very stylish.

puzzles.title: Pie Piece Lineup
puzzles.prompt: The pie tie says: ‘I am missing 6/8.’ Build exactly 6/8 using slices.

ui.introLine: Assemble the missing pie fraction before the pie asks for a promotion.

hints: All slices have the same denominator (eighths). Add the numerators.
Try using one big slice (like 4/8) then make up the rest.

puzzles.title: Laser Ruler Drift
puzzles.prompt: Slide the marker to the correct decimal locations and lock them in.

ui.introLine: The ruler is slippery. The decimals are shy. Be brave.
failQuips: That mark slid into the wrong timeline.

hints: Look at the endpoints on the line to know the range.
Lock each round before moving on.

puzzles.title: Sprinkle Percentage Paint
puzzles.prompt: Paint exactly 25% of the sprinkles. The sprinkles are dramatic. They will count.

ui.introLine: Paint the correct percent, or the sprinkles will form a union.
successQuips: The sprinkles applaud in tiny voices.
failQuips: That’s… a different percent. A rebellious percent.
The paint refuses to sign the paperwork.

hints: Here it’s out of 20. So find 25% of 20.

puzzles.title: The Triple-Identity Parade
puzzles.prompt: Match fractions, decimals, and percents that mean the same amount.

ui.introLine: Three disguises. One value. The math is undercover.
successQuips: The chart stops winking at you.
failQuips: That trio is not related by blood OR math.
The decimal point throws a tiny tantrum.

finalQuestion.question: Who swapped the pie chart with a real pie wearing a tie?
correctRationale: The trio chart shows 1/4 = 0.25 = 25%, not 0.4 or 40%.
Halfalina’s ‘precise’ conversion is incorrect—so her alibi wobbles.
The other suspects’ conversions match the evidence.

lines: His ruler marks are consistent with the decimal clue.
Percentula is loud, but the math checks out.

correct.headline: CASE CLOSED: The Countess was 40% wrong (which is… very wrong).
bodyParagraphs: Countess Halfalina gasped, then tried to bribe the pie with cheese.
When that failed, she admitted she swapped the pie chart for a ‘more charismatic chart’.
The pie removed its tie and revealed a tiny sticky note: ‘I regret everything.’
Town Hall’s pie chart was recovered safely… and immediately laminated out of spite.

incorrect.headline: NOPE: The pie remains employed.
bodyParagraphs: That accusation didn’t stick. Unlike the pie.
Re-check the conversions: the liar is hiding in the fraction/decimal/percent mix.

badges.name: Fraction Detective
badges.description: Solved the case without getting eaten by a pie chart.
